timeline.bodyText:
Edit the system environment variables is a button on Windows OS, not a button or value in OpenRefine.  So it should not use 1 tick (inline code).  We do need conventions however, so let's write some down.
@allanaaa what do we do for buttons and elements on the OS's ?  Perhaps we  can borrow conventions that others do, like what MS does? https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/versioncontrol
Convention Suggestions:

Code and Values can use 1 (inline code) or 3 backticks (codeblock)
Use a nice style for keyboard commands (or just Bold for now since we don't have many) Enter, Ctrl-C, Shift+F5
For OpenRefine buttons we can use the menuItem class
For OS buttons and elements we can use a simple Bold

You can right-click and copy the Permalink URL to copy the current view state to your clipboard, without refreshing the tab you’re using.
